conclusion: Understanding gravitational force and its effect on objects in motion is necessary to solve the problem.
Objects A and B will experience the force of gravity when placed down at the location of objects A, B, C, and D.
The force of gravity will cause objects A and B to fall towards the surface.
The force of gravity acts downward, pulling the objects towards the surface.
Objects moving through the air will initially move downward due to gravity and will stop when they reach the surface.
Objects A and B will fall towards the surface due to gravity, resulting in contact with objects A, B, C, and D.
The objects will fall to the surface.
